name: Crunchy Cold Shrimp Salad
author: Lisa Johnston
summary: This is a homemade recipe that I made after trying to duplicate it from a restaurant I visited. I didn't see a recipe similar to it on Allrecipes so I had to submit it. Hope you all enjoy this cold, light, and refreshing shrimp salad as much as I do! Serve over a bed of butter lettuce or romaine lettuce.
ingredients: ½ cup creamy salad dressing (such as Miracle Whip®)
4 stalks celery, diced, or more to taste
4  scallions, diced, or more to taste
2 tablespoons seafood seasoning (such as Old Bay®), or more to taste
1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil
Stir in pasta and return to a boil
Cook pasta uncovered, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 10 minutes
Drain and let cool to room temperature, at least 15 minutes
Mix the cooled pasta, shrimp, salad dressing, celery, lemon, scallions, seafood seasoning, salt, and pepper together
Chill until ice-cold, at least 1 hour
